org.block.panel.context

Class DragContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.block.panel.context.DragContext

  • public class DragContext
extends java.lang.Object
    All information about a block being dragged.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      DragContext()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Optional<Block> getAttached()

        public DragContext()

    • Method Detail

      • getAttached

        public java.util.Optional<Block> getAttached()
        If the dragging block has been attached to another block, then that will be provided here.
        Returns:
        A optional value of the attached block to the block being dragged.

      • setAttached

        public DragContext setAttached(Block attached)
        Sets the block that is attaching the dragged block
        Parameters:
        attached - The attached block
        Returns:
        itself for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided block does not have the dragging block attached

      • getDragging

        public Block getDragging()
        Gets the block being dragged
        Returns:
        The block being dragged

      • setDragging

        public DragContext setDragging(Block dragging)
        Sets the block being dragged. Please note that this may not work depending on the implementation of the dragging
        Parameters:
        dragging - The block being dragged
        Returns:
        Itself for chaining

      • getOffX

        public int getOffX()
        Gets the X offset. This prevents the annoyance of Blocks moving way too much after a slight drag.
        Returns:
        The X offset in pixels

      • setOffX

        public DragContext setOffX(int offX)
        Sets the X offset.
        Parameters:
        offX - The X offset
        Returns:
        Itself for chaining

      • getOffY

        public int getOffY()
        Gets the Y offset. This prevents the annoyance of Blocks moving way too much after a slight drag.
        Returns:
        The Y offset in pixels

      • setOffY

        public DragContext setOffY(int offY)
        Sets the Y offset.
        Parameters:
        offY - The Y offset
        Returns:
        Itself for chaining
